111.content:
One year…

It had been exactly one year since you met Téa Gardner. You thought it would difficult, moving house, a new school, leaving your old friends behind. You thought it would take you a while to adjust to everything and make new friends at Domino High, but it didn't. Not when you mentioned offhandedly that you played Duel Monsters. One lunchtime, you inadvertently let it slip that you had recently picked up the game to a group of kids, when all of a sudden, THE Yugi Muto, who had defeated Pegasus at Duelist Kingdom, invited you to come hang out at his house after school.

There was no way that you could turn down an invitation from the King of Games, and so Yugi and you met up with his other friends after school at his house. Joey Wheeler, Tristan Taylor and… Téa Gardner.

You hadn't told anyone this, but as your eyes met Téa’s for the first time, it was love at first sight. She was like nothing you had ever seen before.

“Hi… I’m (name) …” you smiled, extending out your hand for her to shake. She moved her smooth, slender hand into yours as you cupped it gently.

“Téa Gardner… nice to meet you, (name) …” she shook your hand as she failed to notice your blush.

Since your initial meeting with Téa, your friendship with her strengthened significantly, until one day, everything changed. It was the late morning of the last Saturday before Spring Break. You and Téa were at a coffee shop enjoying their special home-baked muffins. At some point, Téa said something about having to go shoe shopping. One on one time with Téa? She had your attention!

“I’ve got to get some new shoes today. Can you come with me and help pick some out?” she asked.

“S-sure Téa! I'd be glad to come.” you said, not even thinking twice.

“R-really?” Téa asked. You nodded. “Thank you so much!” she smiled. “It’s near impossible for me to go shopping with Yugi or Joey without them running off to buy cards for their decks. I promise it won’t take long. I just need you to tell me what you think, okay?”

The two of you went to the Domino City Mall where she modeled several pairs of shoes and sandals for you. She came out barefoot once and you ‘jokingly’ told her "Those are perfect!”. She giggled because she thought you were just being silly. But actually, you were honest about that. She looked best barefoot.

You helped her select a few pairs of shoes and then left. She took you to her house to model them some more. You were perfectly content sitting on the floor of her makeshift dance studio as she twirled around. You remembered that she had told you once of her dream to travel to the United States and study dancing at one of the country’s top universities. You remembered you told her that such a strong-willed beautiful girl like her could do anything she set her mind to.

You smiled as you looked her over. After a while, she noticed that you had been staring at her with a soft smile on your face. “Is something wrong, (name)?” Téa asked, bringing you back to reality. “You're staring at my feet kinda weird.” she said bluntly.

You just blushed, unable to say anything. Téa walked over to you, sitting down on the floor beside you as your blush deepened.

“(name)…” Téa began, her look slowly turning to one of concern. “Whatever’s happening with you, you can tell me. We've been close friends for a some time now. So what's going on?” Her tone was serious and yet… seemed sweeter than usual.

You gulped. For a brief moment, you seriously considered telling Téa how you felt about her. You had been dropping hints for a while, but she had never picked up on any of them. Either she wasn’t interested in you, or she just wasn't good at noticing male body language. Even so, the fact that you’d had feelings for her for so long was eating you up inside. Now was the perfect moment. You just had to lay it all on the line. You had to take the leap. You had to tell her how you felt.

“Téa… the thing is…

112.content:
It had been a couple of months since you had met the duelist known as Mai Valentine. You met her at the supermarket and became instantly smitten by her. Others would call it a crush, but to you, it was something more than that. She was 27 and you were only 17, which meant having any sort of relationship with her would be frowned upon by wider society. Besides, she didn't really know you that well to begin with anyway. You however, recognized her from her appearance at Battle City, where you were able to witness all of her duels except for the finals match, which you heard she lost.

You encountered her at the supermarket buying groceries for herself when she was harassed by an older man. You came to her aid, although you didn't need to, and you quickly became good friends.

Today, you and Mai had a Tag Duel against some siblings that lived down the street from you. The duel was an easy win, you and Mai were in perfect sync.

“And now, I activate Monster Reborn to revive Mai's Harpie's Pet Dragon!” you shouted as the giant red dragon appeared behind you, smoke blowing out of its nostrils. “Attack!” you yelled, thrusting your arm forward.

Mai's monster ripped through the kid's Winged Cleaver and won the game for the both of you. “Awww... no way!” the boy shouted.

“Sorry, hon!” Mai grinned. “You two will need to practice more before you ever have the chance of beating us!”

“We'll get better, promise! C'mon sis!” the boy cheered, pulling on his sister's arm until they were out of sight.

“Well, that was easy. How about we duel each other?” Mai asked you.

“You're on! But let's make a wager here.” you answered.

“What kind of wager?” she asked, her interest peaked.

“The loser of the duel will have to do one thing that the winner wants, no matter what the request. You in?” you asked.

Mai smiled. “He's still young. I doubt he'll ask me to do anything too bad if I lose.” she thought. “Of course!” she shouted.

"Duel!"

* * * * * *

"Chaos Emperor Dragon, attack Harpie Lady Sisters!" you shouted.

Your monster charged its attack in its mouth before letting it loose on Mai's monsters. This was probably one of the toughest duels you had ever fought in your entire life. Mai was a seasoned veteran who competed in many illustrious Duel Monsters tournaments. You on the other hand had never entered an official tournament in your life.

Yet somehow, throughout the duel you were able to keep equal pace with Mai, and overcoming her for an instant, you won the duel. It was no wonder that Mai became interested in you.

"Wow, hon. That was a close game, that's for sure. So, what's it gonna be? What do you want?" Mai asked you.

You had been so caught up in the duel that you had completely forgotten about your bet with Mai. Now though, you had the opportunity to ask Mai to do one thing, and one thing only. There were so many things you wanted from Mai, but three things stuck out in your mind.

After a moment’s hesitance, you decided to...
112.title: More Than Just a Crush

1121.content:
This was it. You had wanted to kiss Mai since the moment you met her. Granted, she was older than you. But you didn't care. The only problems were that you had never kissed a girl nor been kissed by one, and what would Mai say or do if you were to ask such a thing. Gathering up all of your courage, you exhaled deeply before forming the words in your head and then saying them aloud to your crush.

"I want to kiss you." you said softly.

Mai's eyes widened in shock. Not a good sign! Now you reckoned that she thought you were just a sleazeball or a pervert trying to come onto her.

“What?! You want to... kiss me? Don't you think that's going over the lines of friendship?” Mai asked, regaining her composure.

You were able to tell that she was confused, and although she tried to sound mad, it was clear to you she was amused by what you had asked her.

“Um, yes. That's right, Mai. I want to kiss you because I-I... have a bit of a crush on you.” you nervously admitted. Although you were kind of worried about what she now thought of you, you were also glad to let it all out. If Mai rejected you, so be it. At least you were able to be straight with her about how you felt.

Mai sighed and then approached you. It wasn't that you were short, but you weren't exactly the tallest guy around. When Mai had finished walking up to you, you realized that you were eye-level to above her chest.

You shakily breathed in as she began.

“Look hon, I know that we've been friends a while now. But it seems like just when I think I have you figured out, you do something like this to blow my mind.” Mai lectured.

“That's fine...” you muttered. “I'm sorry I asked you.”

“Now hold on just one freakin' minute!” Mai shouted, surprising you. “I never said you can't kiss me. I'm just saying that you surprised me there, okay. Even if I didn't WANT to do this, I still would because my word is as good as gold.” Mai stated.

It was weird. Mai seemed to be messing with you now. She was talking like it was no big deal, yet her words sounded as if she was annoyed that you even asked this. And her cheeks twitched slightly every few seconds as if there was a chance she wanted you to kiss her.

“Well? What are you waiting for? Are you gonna kiss me or what?” Mai asked with a smile.

From watching her duels, you knew that it was rare to see her smile at anyone like how she was smiling at you now, so you nervously puckered up, leaned in, and gave Mai a soft, gentle kiss on the cheek. You felt a tingle inside as your lips made contact with her skin.

You took in the alluring scent of the expensive perfume that Mai had sprayed herself with at some point in the day or another. You soon pulled away, you heart beating the hardest it ever had before. If you were to die right now, you'd die a happy young man. Even if Mai didn't see you as anything more than a friend, the fact that you got to kiss her meant the world to you.

You were so lost in your own head, that you failed to notice that Mai had a seductive smile on her face, and her violet-colored eyes were staring deep into yours.

“You call that a kiss?” Mai asked. You could tell by the tone she used that she was joking with her statement, but because of that, you didn't know why she even asked that.

“Sorry?” you asked, utterly confused.

“You need to do things right if you do them at all. THIS is what a REAL kiss is like.” Mai slyly said.

Before you could say or do anything, Mai put her arms around your neck and pressed her lips tightly, yet gently against your own. You almost fell over from shock as Mai's kiss overtook all of your senses.

Mai steadily held onto you as she looked deep into your eyes. As she had done so, that tingle you got earlier turned into an all-out blast of pleasure. You couldn't help but blush as Mai's eyes twinkled in the light of the setting sun.

112121.content:
You were woken just after midnight by the sound of Mai talking in her sleep.

“Someone... anyone... please help me...”

You looked at Mai and noticed that she was crying, tears streaming down her face. “Mai?” you asked softly.

“Let me out, please...” Mai spoke.

You shook Mai lightly by her shoulders, which woke her up with a start, also surprising you by how much of a light sleeper she seemed to be.

“(name)” she asked.

“Are you okay? You were talking in your sleep, and you look like you've been crying.”

“O-of course! Everything's fine!” she insisted, before exhaling deeply.

“I can tell that you're not fine, Mai. No one cries in their sleep from a regular dream. You were having a nightmare, and you sounded really terrified. If anything's on your mind, Mai, you can tell me. If it's a secret, I'll take it to my grave, and if I can help in any way, I'll try my utmost to do so.” you said, meaning every word.

Mai just stared at you silently, the pale moonlight breaking through the curtains. She then leaned in and gently kissed you on the lips before pulling away once more. You could taste the tears on her skin.

“You're not like anyone else I've ever met, (name). You're so wise for your age. It's one of the reasons why I feel like I can really open up to you, like you did to me.”

“Mai...” you muttered.

“I've been having these reoccurring nightmares for a while now.” Mai began. “At Battle City, I lost my finals match to Marik Ishtar, a man who was at the time in possession of The Winged Dragon of Ra, one the most powerful cards in all of Duel Monsters. When I dueled him, it wasn't like when I dueled you. He was one of the most psychotic people I have ever met in my life. He managed to somehow trap me within my own mind and fill me with so much self-doubt that I thought I would die. I keep dreaming that he's here, (name). That he's here and he traps me.”

Tears began to well up in Mai's eyes once more. It was obvious that this was a very emotional topic for her to talk about. For the first time, you saw a side of Mai that you had never seen before. A side of vulnerability. You quickly hugged her. “I'm sorry, really. I'm not sure how I can help you.” you said, honestly. “But if there is anything you need of me, just ask.”

“There is one thing...” Mai muttered, sniffing over and over again due to her crying. Mai then leaned close to you. “Stay by my side... please...” she whispered.

“Of course.” you said without a second thought.

Mai smiled and grabbed a tissue from her bedside table, wiping away the tears. “Thank you, (name). You don't know how much it means to me to have someone like you by my side.”

You blushed profusely. “I'm flattered that you trust me so much.”

Mai then gently caressed your cheek. “I'm sorry for waking you. We should try getting back to sleep...”

You nodded, shifting yourself around in the bed. The morning would mark the turning of a new leaf. No matter what, you would help Mai overcome the darkness that had gripped her soul.
112121.title: Revelations

1121211.content:
Sunlight streamed in from Mai's bedroom window and ran across your face. You scrunched your face as your consciousness stirred and you slowly opened your eyes.

You wiped the sleep out of your eyes and noticed that you were alone in Mai's bed. The sunlight created a glare on Mai's bedroom clock, so you were unable to read the time, but you could tell that it was late morning.

You got up and pulled back the sheets to neaten your side of the bed, before letting out a yawn and giving yourself a quick stretch. It was then that you noticed a piece of paper on Mai's bedside table.

Walking over and picking it up, you read it to yourself. "Gone out to get us some breakfast. Be back in a bit. Feel free to make yourself at home. xoxo" the paper was then signed with a red lipstick print in the shape of her lips.

You smiled. The paper smelt like her. Putting the paper down, you went into Mai's bathroom and gave yourself a quick shower to freshen up. When you finished, you used one of her towels to dry your body, and proceeded to put your clothes back on.

The smell of breakfast filled your nose as Mai entered the room. "Mornin' hon." she said, holding a paper bag with the Golden Arches on it in her left hand and a flyer in her right. "I hope you're hungry."

"Good morning, Mai." you greeted happily. You looked at bag. It seemed like it had so much food in it that it would burst at any second.

Mai saw you looking at the bag and smiled. "C'mon. Let's go eat in the dining room."

You nodded, following Mai out to the dining room table. The table was elegantly set with a glass vase filled with water and roses sitting in the center. As Mai was organizing the food on the counter, you took the liberty of moving both chairs out.

When Mai turned around, she smiled as she noticed what you had done. "You're a real gentlemen."

"Well thank you for buying me breakfast." you blushed. "I'll pay you back my share as soon as I-"

You were cut off as Mai put the plates down on the table and then gently placed a finger to your lips. "There's no need for you to pay me back, Anon. I want to buy you food and I enjoy your company. Please sit." Mai insisted.

You sat down on your chair and looked at the spread in front of you. On your plate was both a Sausage and Egg McMuffin, a Bacon and Egg McMuffin, three hash browns, and a stack of pancakes. To the left of your plate was a huge plastic cup filled with orange juice.

You glanced over at Mai, who was now seated opposite you and daintily eating the food off of her plate. She looked back at you and saw that you hadn't touched your food. "I didn't know what you wanted, so I just got you a bit of everything. Sorry if it's not what you wanted."

"N-no! It's not that!" you assured her. "The food looks great! I'm just unsure where to start."

"Oh, well if you're worried about how you eat in front of me, don't worry. Joey is one of the heaviest eaters I've seen in my whole life!" Mai giggled.

"M'kay then..." you muttered, taking a bite out of your Sausage and Egg McMuffin.

The both of you didn't say a word during your meal. It took some effort, but you managed to successfully eat everything on your plate.

"Thank you so much for the meal, Mai. It was lovely." you said, unintentionally let out a little burp at the end, causing you to cover your mouth and Mai to giggle in response. "Excuse me."

"It's no problem, hon." Mai smiled, taking a sip of her orange juice, still not having finished her meal. You happily stayed seated as you waited for Mai to finish. 114.content:
You had been friends with Rebecca Hawkins for a while. After graduating from a High School in Weckwood, you were given a scholarship to study at one of the most prestigious colleges in America, Harvard University. You would've been a fool to turn down the offer so you accepted. The very next day, you flew to Massachusetts and began the next phase of your academic life. To say the least, you were surprised to meet a fifteen year old child protégée who was not only tacking some of the toughest courses Harvard had to offer, but was also the best Duel Monsters player in the United States.

You formally met her during a study session with a bunch of other students. Finals were coming up, so of course, tensions were high. The only person who didn't seem to be stressing out was Rebecca. Leaning over to her seat, you asked, “Hey… uh, Rebecca, right?” she nodded. “How are you so calm right now? Finals are less than a week away.”

She smiled. “Why shouldn't I be calm?” she asked you back. “I've done enough study.” She then glanced over at the copious amount of notes you had written into a blank exercise book. “And judging by the state of your notebook, I’d say you have too. Trust me, you've got nothing to worry about.”

Rebecca was right. The two of you passed all your final exams with nothing but the highest marks. The grueling amount of time you put into study had paid off. But if it hadn't have been for Rebecca, you probably would've just stressed yourself so much that you wouldn't have been able to focus at all during the exams.

After graduation, you headed back home and you thought you’d never see her again. But that wasn't the case. It turned out that she and her grandfather, Professor Arthur Hawkins, spent quite a lot of time in Japan. When you saw her at the arcade a year later, you went over to say hi to her, but feared she may have forgotten all about you. That fear left you when, as soon as she saw you, she ran up to you and hugged you.

“Oh my God! (name)?! It’s been so long, how’ve you been?!” she asked.

“I’ve been getting along fine…” you said nonchalantly.

“Excellent! Excellent!” Rebecca cheered. “Hey, come with me. I've got a couple friends who I’m sure you’d love to meet.” Before you could even say anything, Rebecca grabbed your wrist and pulled you along to another part of the arcade, one with a DDR machine. It was there that you were introduced to Yugi Muto, Joey Wheeler, Téa Gardner and Tristan Taylor. Soon after, Rebecca gave you her phone number and address and asked you to come over whenever you liked.

The next few months you spent getting reacquainted with Rebecca and took note of how she interacted with her friends, specifically Yugi. Rebecca would always appear out of nowhere at some of the most random times and wrap her arms around him, or even give him a little peck on the cheek, to which Yugi would do little more than blush. You were a little bummed that she didn't do this with you. You thought she was kinda cute.

Today, you and Rebecca were at her grandpa's lab chatting and just basically hanging out. Somewhere along the lines, she asked you if you thought she was pretty. “Rebecca? Of course you are! You're one of the prettiest girls I know!” you said with a smile.

“Well, why doesn't Yugi like me then?” she asked. This was kind of an awkward question. You had known about Rebecca’s infatuation with Yugi. You had never fully understood it, given Yugi’s apparent apathy towards Rebecca.

You weren't really fond of all that. You’d actually developed a crush on Rebecca recently, but you hadn't yet worked up the nerve to tell her. Sure, it was a bit manipulating, but all you could do was try and deter Rebecca from Yugi long enough for Rebecca to lose interest in him.

“I don't know. I think he's just not into girls yet. He is kinda young.” you stated. Rebecca sighed with disappointment. You tried your best to convince her that she should meet other guys, namely you, but she was a bit reluctant. You could tell she was feeling a little down, completely different to how she was a few months ago.

“Hey, let's go get lunch and we can talk about it then.” you offered. Rebecca agreed and the two of you went to McDonald's for burgers and milkshakes. While you ate, you also kept at trying to convince her to move on. You were starting to get to her when you started to complement her. Suddenly, you felt her slide her socked foot over your leg! She was playing footsie with you! Pretending not to notice, you continued complementing her. Soon, you were both done eating and you invited her back to your house.

info.brief_description: A Hentai story which takes place in the world of Yu-Gi-Oh! Original concept by brandonlee.
info.description:
Recently, I noticed that this story had been taken down from Writing.Com for whatever reason. I genuinely enjoyed the story and was sad to see it removed. Therefore, I am hoping for this item to act as a reboot of Dr. Awesome Funk's Original Story. Many, in fact most of the story's original guidelines for chapter submission will apply here, however I would also like to add a few guidelines of my own. Despite the story's namesake, a pathway does not necessarily have to contain any Foot Fetish-related content. I understand that many contributors have differing likes and dislikes and as such, I don't wish to discriminate against anyone who may have different tastes to other people.

I will allow basically anything, so long as it has relevance or significance to the plot. The three things that I will not allow though are:

Death
Crossovers (no having characters from two different series [i.e GX and 5D's] interacting within the same timeline. Note that you can disregard this rule with the 'Rebecca's Cool Toy' pathway)
Content which breaks from reality (Inflation, TF, vore, unbirth etc.)

If you're not sure if a chapter you wish to add violates any of the above, feel free to email me on the site for clarification. Otherwise, please contact me if you have any concerns.

When writing a chapter, please refer to the characters by their 4kids dub names.

I would generally like this to be an actual story (meaning that each pathway should have a plot, no continuous sexual activities just for the sake of it). Any chapters I find with spelling mistakes or grammatical errors will be corrected. I encourage those who created additions for the original story to add to this one.

Original characters by Kazuki Takahashi
Original story and concept by Dr. Awesome Funk

Enjoy!

7/10/15 Update: From now on the MC is to be referred as Anon, a stand in for Anonymous reader, because typing *your name* all the time is annoying.
